channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023081059
item.description:
Report X-2023081059

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER AIN SECTION-B, DOOR 19. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION BY RESPONDER REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 1-GALLON JUG WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023080895
item.description:
Report X-2023080895

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAZ MAT WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WHEN IT ARRIVED AT FACILITY ALONG WITH PACKAGE THAT WAS BESIDE IT IN THE LIQUID. A CERTIFIED ADMIN TOOK THE PROPER PROCEDURES TO MAKE SURE THE HAZMAT WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW DRUN DescribePack: LOOSE LID CAUSED PRODUCT TO SPILL OUT ONTO ANOTHER PACKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CERTIFIED ADMIN MADE SURE THAT THEY HAD GLOVES ON TO HANDLE THE SPILL. THE LEAKING HAZMAT WAS IN A TOTE WITH PRODUCT THAT WAS LEAKED ON BEFORE BEING PLACED INTO A YELLW DRUM.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found in cage, handle was missing and the contents were leaking into the containment tote DescribePack: plastic can was gouged and missing components, leaking from the lid and the bottom of the bucket DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: bucket was placed in a lined hazmat tote with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023080836
item.description:
Report X-2023080836

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON OUR LOADING DOCK. IT WAS IN AN UNMARKED BOX THAT HAD BEEN REPACKED BY ANOTHER STATION WHO FAILED TO ADD ANY UP ARROWS OR DIAMOND LABELS ONTO THE PACKAGE. THEY DID TAPE THE OP-900 TO THE PACKAGE. THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGH IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. THEY ALSO FAILED TO RELABEL THE PACKAGE THEY JUST REPACKED IT INTO AN UNMARKED BOX AND TRIED TO SEND IT FORWARD. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS WAY TO BIG FOR JUST THE THREE ITEMS THAT WERE LOOSE INSIDE OF IT. NORMALLY THESE PACKAGES CONTAIN FOUR BOTTLES NOT JUST THREE. WHICH LEADS ME TO BELIEVE SINCE IT WAS REPACKED IF THE MISSING BOTTLE MAY OF BEEN DAMAGED. ONE OF THE ITEMS INSIDE THE PACKAGE DID OPEN FROM THE LID CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED ITEM WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING. THE LAST TWO UNDAMGED ITEMS HAVE BEEN PROPERLY REPACKED SO THEY MAY BE RTS.

item.title: Report X-2023081722
item.description:
Report X-2023081722

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY MARKED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED BY A SORTER ON THE SLIDE OF THE HUB SECONDARY THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE IMMIDIATE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES, DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND TRANSPORDED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FUTHER ISNPECTION, ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP 3/4 TURN, AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL, THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALL 95 POUND CAPACITY FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023080738
item.description:
Report X-2023080738

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Final walk for Sunrise shift and the was located at the end of a load area. It had plastic under it preventing transfer to other pkg's and surfaces. It was brought to Q/A for processing. DescribePack: Only one can totally failed leaking at the bottom of can at a corner at a seam it is a inward hole. Note: The cans are not a tight fit, they have some movement abilities. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was already on plastic and the box was transferred to a hazardous bag and tote w/ lid, while awaiting processing.

item.title: Report E-2023080824
item.description:
Report E-2023080824

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 9 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink (UN1210) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surfaces. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to containerize all UN1210-impacted material in one (1) 85-gallon drum for future disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2023080727

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into the one metal 55 gallon drum of dabco NE400 (un2735) releasing 45 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
